data.title: Beautful Art Deco Building
data.text: Buffalo City Hall is a Beautiful examples of some of the best architecture in Buffalo!!!  And the view from the Observation Level is the best there is in the city!

data.title: Take the trip to the free top floor overlook!
data.text: A vintage city hall and certainly a vintage elevator ride to the top.  Why you can see Canada!  Or maybe Russia if you are Sarah Palin!

data.title: Art Deco at its finest
data.text: Beautiful building constructed in the Art Deco style.  Be sure to take the tour of the building which includes visiting some of the offices, the court room, the mayor's office and the observation deck on the 28th floor.  Note: you have to go through a TSA style check point upon entering the building so be prepared by not bring any knives, or other prohibited things with you.  Also, you have to take the stairs from the 25th to 28th floor to see the observation deck.  The rest is accessible by elevator.

data.title: Gorgeous Craftsmanship
data.text: My husband saw this in the skyline when we were approaching downtown and wanted to go.  We were so glad we did!  Unfortunately the tours are not reliable to run, but a very kind gentleman at the information desk agreed to show us around after his shift.  We are so glad we were able to see the workmanship of this gorgeous building and have special parts pointed out to us.  This is one of the most beautiful buildings we have visited recently.  It's an example of what true craftsmen could do.  Simply splendid!

data.title: wonderful!
data.text: the most beautiful wedding venue I have ever been too. the stained glass ceiling is awesome!!  must see to appreciate.

data.title: Big & Grand
data.text: Very beautiful & Grand - Buffalo City Hall (Arc Deco!)  I think its one of the tallest City Hall in N. America.  Look closely and you can see the detailed work that was put into this building.  Check out the pillars! :)

data.title: I felt like I was in the Atlas Shrugged money
data.text: The art deco style really make you fell like you've been transports back in time. Just going into the lobby (thru security)   is a lesson in history.

data.title: Interesting Art Deco Building
data.text: This was a fun place to wander around to look at the Art Deco design, both inside and out. It is a working city hall, so you need to visit on weekdays and pass through security. The lobby area has several large murals and the elevators on that level are beautiful. On the 13th floor is the council chamber with a large stained glass skylight. The observation deck is accessed by taking the elevator to the 25th floor and climbing the stairs to the 28th floor. Nice views of the city and lake on a clear day.

data.title: BUFFALO IS AWESOME!
data.text:
OK... here's the deal: Start off with this beautiful art deco building... add to this the fact that you can go in and for absolutely NO CHARGE just take the elevator up to the observation deck and enjoy a panoramic view of the city, harbor, and a bit of the "country."

BUT WAIT! THERE'S MORE!

If you take the elevator to the "main" floor where the Council Chambers are... if the body isn't in session you can check the Chambers out! Get this: If the Chambers are locked... chances are is all it'll take is a request - a "please" to someone in the City Clerk's office - and you'll get your own little tour! (I kid you not! The Deputy City Clerk gave my wife and I a tour... and then gave us little "Buffalo" pins as souvenirs!

"NICE." That's the word that comes to mind when I think about Buffalo. The people are NICE!

data.title: Great Art Deco Building
data.text: From the outside, it is really a great building. Once you get Inside, the décorations are very nice, but it shows its age.

data.title: What a view!
data.text: As part of a peddle tour, friends and I stopped at City Hall.  We were greeted by very courteous security officers.  At the top of City Hall we were able to take beautiful pictures!

data.title: Beautiful inside and out
data.text: The building from the outside is ornate and massive. It is something to just take a few minutes and stare at it. From the reviews we found out that parking behind the building in the lot was easiest. And those reviews were right. We parked across the old fire station which is also a cool building to check out. You will have to go through a metal detector and such. If you come in from the back you are on the ground floor and will have to either climb some stairs up to the main floor or catch the elevator. The main floor has murals and paintings and sculptures. But if you tend to run hot the building during the summer can be really hot. There are huge fans in the lobby though. Info desk is smack in the middle. Go up to the 28th floor and climb up another flight of stairs to get to the observation tower. The views are awesome and it's open air so you can get good pictures through the metal holes. It is free to see this and some of the signs have been vandalized but the few that are left have great historical info. Check it out.

data.title: Lovely building
data.text:
Absolutely lovely building although you wonder what you have let yourself in for when you get to the security to get in.
Once past this it is very pleasant and when you go up to the free observation deck the views are fantastic.

data.title: Amazing Art Deco Building
data.text: Great building - it's old but beautiful and it's a free trip up to the observation floor.  Do note that you have to walk up from the 25th floor to the 28th floor.

data.title: Wills, deeds, information
data.text: Refer to website. Tours offered. Many services offered. Pat utilities, taxes. Mayors office. Many departments and citizen services offered.

data.title: Its FREE See the view from the top
data.text: What a beautiful building. You need to see the inside very pretty and then go to the top of the building to the observation deck and look at the beautiful views of the city ..you will be happy you went to this historic building..it is a treasure.

data.title: Tour Guide was a No Show
data.text:
The building was beautiful, but the tour guide didn't show up on the day we went. After talking to the security staff, it seems like this is a fairly common occurrence. I guess you get what you pay for when it comes to free tours. One of the staff members gave us a quick run down about how we could see the sights in building, but I was much more interested in hearing about the history of the art and architecture. 

The view from the observation deck was nice. It was a clear day, so we could see the Niagara skyline in the distance. The chamber in the 13th floor was pretty, and the artdeco paintings on the ground floor were interesting. I just wish there was a tour guide to provide additional knowledge about what we saw.

data.title: Impressive Architecture  design building
data.text: This historic building is very picturesque. I took many pictures of this building  both outside and inside. Inside on the first floor beautiful art deco  design on ceiling and walls. It is worth the time to go to the top floor  observation  tower to view  the city skyline and lake.

data.title: Such a sad place
data.text:
Worst parking in the entire world.
The "helpers" at the door don't know where anything is.
I hate them!
Once you wonder around aimlessly you eventually come to an office with people waiting out the door for hours and who leave crying

data.title: Lots of History in pure beauty
data.text: taking an afternoon tour of city hall was amazing. not only do you learn about the history behind the murals and structure of the building but you get to see offices you may not have otherwise saw from a trip there. The observatory deck is by far my favorite spot. The views of the city are simply stunning.
